summary: The Military Spouse Hiring Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to incentivize employers to hire spouses of military personnel. It proposes to make employers of qualified military spouses eligible for the work opportunity credit. A 'qualified military spouse' is defined as someone certified by the designated local agency and is a spouse of a member of the Armed Forces. The changes will apply to amounts paid or incurred after the date the act is passed.
